title: Rose Bay, the elite Sydney pocket with harbour views and trophy homes
text:
Seaplanes are available from Rose Bay not far from Catalina restaurant. Steven Woodburn

And let’s not forget the most decadent form of transport: the seaplanes departing not far from Catalina restaurant, offering joyrides over the harbour as well as day trips.

Taylor says New South Head Road used to be the most prominent retail hotspot. Over the past decade, that strip has started to face some stiff competition from Old South Head Road to the east.

New South Head Road is one of the suburb’s premier retail hotspots. Steven Woodburn

Another big change has been a changing of the guard in terms of demographics as older home owners have downsized.

Jacqueline Blacket, director at The Blacket Agency, says the suburb is on the way to becoming the new Double Bay. Long one of Sydney’s dowager suburbs, Double Bay burst back onto the scene a few years ago as an ultra-fashionable enclave.

“At Rose Bay, you’ve got the harbour on one side, you’re still really close to the beach at Bondi but you’re not paying those crazy beach prices,” Blacket says. “It’s really been revitalised.”

Rattan ceilings form part of the look in the revamped Hotel Rose Bay. Steven Woodburn

Advertisement

Home styles range from gracious 1800s cottages to shiny new waterfront mansions and everything in between. Expect to pay in the low to mid to $1 millions for a two-bedroom unit. Free-standing houses tend to range from $3.5 million unrenovated to more than $5.5 million with a facelift.

Catalina in Rose Bay. Christopher Pearce

Rose Bay Hotel has had its own nip and tuck recently. The fresh new Richards Stanisich-designed look includes rattan ceilings, dark timber and touches of emerald green. The hotel’s general manager, Toby Chick, describes it as “a little bit of a New Orleans prohibition feel”.

“I think there was quite a lot of old money in Rose Bay,” Check says. “Now we’re starting to see more younger families are moving into the area.”

And one to buy

4/45 Chaleyer Street, Rose Bay NSW.

Tall, dark and handsome with its on-trend charcoal walls and top-floor north-facing position, this unit is within walking distance of Old South Head Road cafes.

Enjoy district views from the main bedroom balcony.

The Blacket Agency is selling the residence with a $978,000 guide.

This story first appeared at Domain.

domain.com.au
description: Multimillion-dollar homes here hog the headlines with their dizzying prices, including the reported $40 million-plus suburb record set last year.
